u.seg: among the people of this district there was a woman who was called Smart, they said.

spanGrp.span: They prefered her in every thing.

u.seg: When a poor man came asking for charity,
when they say: ‘Child! Give alms to this man!’
the boy snatches the sorghum from a bag with his hands surrounding the post, they said.

spanGrp.span: toːfi gidhiːsej mhalle jʔajeː haːj jʔeːtiːt /
around the post with his hands he surrounds it and
he snatches millet, they said, the boy, (from) his bag.
he cries, they said, the boy’s hands

u.seg: he cries, they said, the boy, his two hands
could not go past the post,
because it was in the middle of both hands.

spanGrp.span: because it was in the middle of both hands.

u.seg: When he cries, the people say: ‘What shall we do?’

spanGrp.span: ‘What shall we do?’ they say, and

u.seg: she says: ‘I can’t see anything else but to dismantle the hut.

spanGrp.span: if you are not dismantling the hut

u.seg: Dismantle the hut!’ she says, they said.
They dismantle the hut, they said.

spanGrp.span: They dismantle the hut, they said.

u.seg: Let it not be our destiny!

spanGrp.span: Let it not be our possessions,
